title: Emmanuel Macron's one-man diplomacy
summary: 'The Two Emmanuel Macrons' (Part 3/4). Since he became president, Macron has led a personal foreign policy, shunning career diplomats.

title: French debt reaches a new peak of €3.3 trillion
summary: French public debt reached 113.7% of GDP in the third quarter, the national statistics institute announced on Friday. Without resolute government action, the rise is likely to continue until 2030, according to the credit rating agency Moody's.

title: US House passes bill to avert government shutdown, Senate vote to follow
summary: On Friday, lawmakers sent a package to the Senate that would keep federal agencies running through mid-March – but the upper chamber only has until midnight, US Eastern time to follow suit or federal agencies will begin shutting.

title: New Syrian leaders say they want to contribute to 'regional peace'
summary: Al-Sharaa, the leader of the Islamist Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) group that seized power in Damascus, was previously the target of US sanctions. But after their first formal contact in Damascus on Friday, Washington announced it had dropped a bounty for his arrest.

title: At least 2 dead and dozens hurt after a car drives into a German Christmas market in a suspected attack
summary: A car drove into a Christmas market in the eastern German city of Magdeburg around 7 pm on Friday, the suspect described by Saxony-Anhalt's regional premier as a 50-year-old Saudi doctor, who has been arrested.

title: Mazan rape trial: for Gisèle Pelicot, an "ordeal" turned into a "fight".
summary: These four moments marked Gisèle Pelicot's journey.

title: Macron faces anger of Mayotte's disaster victims
summary: The president visited the Indian Ocean territory devastated by Cyclone Chido. He had to respond to accusations by locals that the state has long since abandoned them. Among other problems, they raised the alarm about problems of accessing clean water, which have only been exacerbated by the disaster.

title: Volkswagen unveils major job cuts in cost-saving drive
summary: German auto giant Volkswagen said Friday it would cut 35,000 jobs by 2030.

title: US scraps $10m bounty for arrest of Syria's new leader
summary: The United States has decided to drop a $10 million reward for the capture of Ahmed al-Sharaa, after meetings between senior diplomats and representatives from Hayat Tahrir al-Sham.

title: Five chefs' tips for successful holiday meals
summary: Spicy Christmas poultry, an aperitif with fermented beverages, savory Alsatian shortbread ... our suggestions to brighten up your holiday meal.

title: Gisèle Pelicot has 'no fear' of appeals trial, says lawyer
summary: Speaking on French radio the day after the verdicts, Gisèle Pelicot's lawyer Stéphane Babonneau said of possible appeal trials: 'If it were to happen, she has already indicated to us that she would face it.'

title: France's anti-terrorism court convicts 8 people of involvement in the 2020 beheading of teacher Samuel Paty
summary: Sentences ranging from 18 months suspended imprisonment to 16 years in prison were handed down to friends of the killer and others involved in the 2020 murder of schoolteacher Samuel Paty.

title: Berlin-Paris high-speed rail route symbolizes Europe's thirst for train travel
summary: French and German train operators have launched a daily round-trip service between the two European capitals. They're betting that the journey time – eight hours – won't put off customers looking to keep their carbon footprint low.

title: 'It's food and drink we need': The plight of survivors in Mayotte's devastated shantytowns
summary: Five days after the disaster, the inhabitants of French territory in the Indian Ocean shantytowns are trying to rebuild their houses in the middle of a field of ruins. Food and water supplies have still not been established.

title: Nick Clegg: 'When it comes to making AI available to Europeans, EU regulators are still moving at a snail's pace'
summary: On artificial intelligence, regulatory complexity is condemning Europe to unnecessary delays and tying its economy in knots, writes Meta's president for global affairs.

title: Trudeau carries out major cabinet reshuffle in face of party pressure
summary: Trudeau is fighting for his political future after the surprise resignation of his deputy prime minister. He changed one-third of his team on Friday.

title: Anti-whaling activist Paul Watson arrives in France after five-month detention
summary: Watson was released on Tuesday after five months of detention in Greenland as Denmark considered whether to extradite him to Japan.

title: Pelicot rape trial: A fair and independent verdict
summary: After three months and 17 days of a historic trial, the criminal court found all 51 defendants guilty. Dominique Pelicot was sentenced to 20 years in jail. The court handed sentences determined on a case-by-case basis. In accordance with the law.

title: Syria: How Italy played the Bashar al-Assad regime card to the end
summary: In July, Rome announced the return of a resident ambassador to Damascus, becoming the first European Union and G7 country to re-establish contact with the overthrown Syrian regime.

title: Syrian soldiers on the army's defeat: 'Refusing orders meant the death penalty or worse – imprisonment in Saydnaya'
summary: Soldiers say they were not kept informed by their officers of the rebels' lightning advance. They also reveal a system based on poorly trained conscripts, which could only survive thanks to Iranian and Russian support.

title: Cyclone Chido probably boosted by very high temperatures in the Indian Ocean
summary: While the link between the highly destructive cyclone in Mayotte and global warming is difficult to establish, the long-term trend is clear: cyclones will become more intense more rapidly, and be associated with more rainfall, due to rising greenhouse gas emissions.

title: The fall of Bashar al-Assad, a blow for Russia in Africa
summary: As a supporter of the deposed regime in Syria, Moscow wishes to retain two military bases there as a logistical base for its operations in the Sahel. Moreover, Vladimir Putin's inability to save his Syrian ally is casting doubt among West African juntas on the solidity and reliability of their Russian partner.

title: French left calls Macron comments reported by Le Monde 'racist'
summary: The Elysée Palace 'firmly denies' that President Emmanuel Macron said that 'the problem with emergency wards in this country is that they're full of Mamadous.' Le Monde stands by its reporting.
